bill_title: to revise certain statutes regarding residence and voting qualifications of magistrate judges.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain statutes regarding residence and voting qualifications of magistrate judges. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 16-12A-5 be amended to read as follows: 16-12A-5. A magistrate shall be a qualified elector in the circuit for which he the magistrate is appointed and shall reside there so long as he the magistrate serves as magistrate in such capacity . A duly appointed clerk or any deputy clerk who meets the qualifications of a magistrate may also be appointed and act as a magistrate. Nothing in this section limits the authority of the Unified Judicial System to temporarily assign a clerk or deputy clerk to serve in another circuit of this state or to limit the jurisdiction of a lay magistrate to act while on temporary duty assignment in another circuit. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain statutes regarding residence and voting qualifications of magistrate judges. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 16-12A-5 be amended to read as follows: 16-12A-5. A magistrate shall be a qualified elector in the circuit for which he the magistrate is appointed and shall reside there so long as he the magistrate serves as magistrate in such capacity . A duly appointed clerk or any deputy clerk who meets the qualifications of a magistrate may also be appointed and act as a magistrate. Nothing in this section limits the authority of the Unified Judicial System to temporarily assign a clerk or deputy clerk to serve in another circuit of this state or limits the jurisdiction of a lay magistrate to act while on temporary duty assignment in another circuit. BILL HISTORY 1/14/98 First read in House and referred to Judiciary. H.J. 38 1/17/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/17/98 Judiciary Do Pass, Passed, AYES 13, NAYS 0. H.J. 62 1/17/98 Judiciary Place on Consent Calendar. 1/20/98 Second reading of consent calendar items. 1/20/98 Second reading of consent calendar items. H.J. 131 1/20/98 House of Representatives Do Pass, Passed, AYES 67, NAYS 0. H.J. 131 1/21/98 First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 157 2/9/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/9/98 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 0. S.J. 377 2/9/98 Judiciary Place on Consent Calendar.
